title: How to Make a Grass Buddy

steps.headline: Select a suitable plastic paint bucket.
steps.description: Inspect it for cracks. Discard if cracked as it will let the soil and water run out. If it's okay, wash it until clean, then dry completely.

steps.headline: Draw a face on a piece of paper.
steps.description: Tape the paper face to the bucket. You can varnish the face too, if liked. This creates a waterproof outer.

steps.headline: Fill the bucket with potting soil.
steps.description: Sprinkle grass seeds on top. Cover lightly with soil.

steps.headline: Water a tiny bit every day.
steps.description: Soon you'll see grass popping up. Once it starts growing, it'll usually thrive.

steps.headline: Trim the grass regularly.
steps.description: Keep it well maintained. The kids will enjoy keeping the grass buddy's "hair" neat and at the same time, learn a lesson in tending to something growing.

steps.headline: Choose a suitable container.
steps.description: Choose something like a coffee can, a yogurt bottle, a plastic food container, etc. Wash and clean the container, allow to dry completely.

steps.headline: Put the stocking inside the container.
steps.description: Pull the end of it over and around the container. This will keep it intact.

steps.headline: Add a small layer of soil to the base of the pot, on top of the stocking.
steps.description: Sprinkle a layer of approximately 2 tablespoons of grass seeds.

steps.headline: Fill the remaining space with soil.
Pick up the top of the stocking.
steps.description: Tie a knot with it to enclose the soil. Ensure that it is firmly in place.

steps.headline: Turn the whole soil-filled stocking ball over.
steps.description: The knot should be at the base of the container.

steps.headline: Add googly eyes for eyes.
steps.description: Draw on any other features. Use waterproof markers and glue as the features will constantly get wet.

steps.headline: Pour water over the grass buddy.
steps.description: Soak it well to ensure it is completely wet.

steps.headline: Transfer the grass buddy to a small plate or saucer, knot end still down.
Wait.
steps.description: Within a week, the grass will sprout and continue to grow.

steps.headline: Trim as needed.
steps.description: To keep the grass buddy neat, trim regularly.
